page.title: 10LOCAL HISTORY,MADDERTY
page.content: {INCHAFFREY ABBEY The Abbey was built about 1200AD by Gilbert,Third Earl of Strathearn. Many students came here to be taught by the monks over the next four centuries. Abbot Maurice ofInchaffrey was chaplain to Robert the Bruce. Before the Battle of Bannockburn,1214,he blessed the Scottish army. During the battle he carried a holy relic among the troops,the embalmed arm of St.Fillan. In thanks Robert gave money for the draining of the marsh lands round the abbey by the digging of the Pow Water,a drainage canal. Bruce is also said to have met John Comyn at this abbey when they were Joint Guardians of Scotland. The abbey was destroyed at the Refomation.
